docs.title: CAOM
docs.text: this is a dev version

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: a general purpose data model for use as the core data model of an astronomical data centre

docs.title: Authors
docs.text: Patrick Dowler, Canadian Astronomy Data Centre

docs.title: objectType Algorithm
docs.text:
the algorithm that was responsible for creating the observation; for a DerivedObservation this is the algorithm that defines the intended set of members to include

Algorithmivoa:string name

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description name ivoa:string common name of the algorithm; the value 'exposure' is reserved for use in SimpleObservation; TBD: publish a list of acceptable values as a machine-readable vocabulary?

docs.title: objectType Artifact
docs.text:
extends CaomEntity

a physical product (typically a file)

Artifactivoa:anyURI uricaom2:DataLinkSemantics productTypecaom2:ReleaseType releaseTypeivoa:string contentTypeivoa:integer contentLengthivoa:anyURI contentChecksumivoa:datetime contentReleaseivoa:anyURI contentReadGroupsivoa:anyURI descriptionIDCaomEntityPartparts0..*

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description uri ivoa:anyURI an identifier that resolves to the storage location of the artifact productType DataLinkSemantics the relationship of this Artifact to the parent Plane (DataLink semantics) releaseType ReleaseType field indicating how access permissions for this artifact are determined contentType ivoa:string optional label specifying the format of the resolved artifact; typically a MIME-type contentLength ivoa:integer optional the size of the resolved artifact; typically file size in bytes contentChecksum ivoa:anyURI optional the checksum of the artifact data; the URI must conform to the pattern {algorithm}:{value}, for example: md5:4be91751541fd804e7207663a0822f56 (NEW in CAOM-2.3) contentRelease ivoa:datetime optional timestamp after which content for the plane is public (new in CAOM-2.4); if set, this value overrides the permission implied by the releaseType and Plane release dates contentReadGroups ivoa:anyURI 0 or more list of groups (of users) that are allowed to access the content of this artifact; this is applicable when the effective release date is null or in the future (new in CAOM-2.4) descriptionID ivoa:anyURI optional identifier for an ArtifactDescription entity (new in CAOM-2.5) parts Part 0 or more the component parts of this artifact

docs.title: enumeration CalibrationLevel
docs.text:
the degree to which data has been calibrated to remove instrumental effects; issue: there is no way to convey the integer serialised values here so it is in the description of each value

CalibrationLevelPLANNEDRAW_INSTRUMENTALRAW_STANDARDCALIBRATEDPRODUCTANALYSIS_PRODUCT

docs.title: Values
docs.text:
• PLANNED - (-1) planned data product that does not yet exist

  • RAW_INSTRUMENTAL - (0) raw data in some opaque instrument-specific format

  • RAW_STANDARD - (1) raw data in a common format

  • CALIBRATED - (2) standard calibration steps have been applied

  • PRODUCT - (3) additional non-standard calibration steps have been applied

  • ANALYSIS_PRODUCT - (4) : data product from scientific analysis

docs.title: abstract objectType CaomEntity
docs.text:
base CAOM entity class to support accumulated metadata checkcums and lastModified timestamps to support synchronisation

CaomEntityivoa:datetime maxLastModifiedivoa:anyURI accMetaChecksumObservationPlaneArtifactArtifactDescriptionPartChunk

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description maxLastModified ivoa:datetime optional maximum timestamp of last modification of this entity and all child entities; the timestamp is intended to be applied or updated when the entity is stored (e.g. in a database) accMetaChecksum ivoa:anyURI optional accumulated checksum of the metadata of this entity and all child entities; (NEW in CAOM-2.3) The URI must conform to the pattern {algorithm}:{value}, for example: md5:4be91751541fd804e7207663a0822f56. The accumulated checksum of an entity is computed by accumulating the byte representation of entity checksums in the following order: (1) the metaChecksum of the current entity, (2) the accMetaChecksum of all child entities accumulated in order of the child's Entity.id. For an entity with no children, the accMetaChecksum is derived only from the metaChecksum but it is not equal to it because it is a checksum of that checksum and not a checksum of the same metadata directly.

docs.title: objectType Chunk
docs.text:
extends CaomEntity

a quantitatively defined subsection of a data array; the part contains the whole array

Chunkcaom2:DataLinkSemantics productTypeivoa:integer naxisivoa:integer positionAxis1ivoa:integer positionAxis2ivoa:integer energyAxisivoa:integer timeAxisivoa:integer polarizationAxisivoa:integer customAxisivoa:integer observableAxisCaomEntitySpatialWCSSpectralWCSTemporalWCSPolarizationWCSCustomWCSObservableAxisposition0..1energy0..1time0..1polarization0..1custom0..1observable0..1

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description productType DataLinkSemantics optional the relationship of this Artifact to the parent Plane (DataLink semantics) naxis ivoa:integer optional number of axes in the data array; value must be in [1,7] since CAOM supports a maximum of seven axes; furthermore, if naxis has a value, the axis index values 1 to {naxis} must be assigned (to positionAxis1, positionAxis2, energyAxis, timeAxis, polarizationAxis, customAxis, and/or observableAxis) and each axis index value assigned to those fields must be unique; axis index values above {naxis} may be assigned in order to preserve the ordering of metadata-only WCS (see FITS-WCS WCSAXES defintion for an example of how this could originate and be used) positionAxis1 ivoa:integer optional index of the first position axis; if set: positionAxis2 and position must also have values positionAxis2 ivoa:integer optional index of the second position axis; if set: positionAxis1 and position must also have values energyAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the energy axis; if set: energy must have a value timeAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the time axis; if set: time must have a value polarizationAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the polarization axis; if set: polarization must have a value customAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the custom axis; if set: custom must have a value observableAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the observable axis; if set: observable must have a value position wcs.SpatialWCS optional spatial WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if positionAxis1 and positionAxis2 indices are null or have values above {naxis}, then the spatial WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one spatial pixel) energy wcs.SpectralWCS optional spectral WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if energyAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the spectral WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one spectral pixel) time wcs.TemporalWCS optional temporal WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if timeAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the time WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one time pixel for the whole data array) polarization wcs.PolarizationWCS optional polarization WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if polarizationAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the polarization WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one polarization pixel) custom wcs.CustomWCS optional custom WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if customAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the custom WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one custom pixel) observable wcs.ObservableAxis optional observable description of the data array or subsection thereof; if observableAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the observable axis is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one observable for the whole data array)

docs.text: name type mult description members ivoa:anyURI 0 or more members are the observations grouped together by the algorithm that defines the derivation; these are the intended components of the composite product -- actual inputs are described by the provenance; members may be simple or derived observations (arbitrary heirarchy); a derived observation made by combining multiple observations is equivalent to a composite observation (CAOM-2.3 and older); derived observations with one or more members may be defined such that they only include a subset of each member (they are extracted from the progenitor)

docs.text: name type mult description bounds types.Interval simple outer bounds of energy coverage of the data (cardinality changed in CAOM-2.5) samples types.IntervalM 1 or more detailed energy coverage of the data (refactored in CAOM-2.5) energyBands EnergyBand 0 or more standard name of the energy regime(s) included in the data (attribute name and cardinality changed in CAOM-2.4) dimension ivoa:integer optional number of measurements (pixels) on the energy axis resolvingPower ivoa:real optional mean spectral resolving power per pixel (relative resolution) resolvingPowerBounds types.Interval optional range of resolving power within the bounds (relative resolution) resolution ivoa:real optional mean absolute spectral resolution per pixel (new in CAOM-2.5) resolutionBounds types.Interval optional range of absolute spectral resolution within the bounds (new in CAOM-2.5) sampleSize ivoa:real optional mean pixel size bandpassName ivoa:string 0 or more telescope- and instrument-specific name for the energy band(s) included; multiple bands may be included if energies from all specified bands are included in the data (in the sense of union) transition wcs.EnergyTransition optional target energy transition for this data restwav ivoa:real optional rest energy of the target energy transition (name changed in CAOM-2.5) calibration CalibrationStatus optional term describing the calibration of the energy axis values (new in CAOM-2.5)

docs.title: enumeration EnergyBand
docs.text:
a general set of energy regions that span the electromagnetic spectrum; work-around: using the name of the literal to convey the serialised value

EnergyBandRadioMillimeterInfraredOpticalUVEUVXrayGammaray

docs.title: Values
docs.text:
• Radio - wavelength greater than ~10mm

  • Millimeter - wavelength from 0.1 to 10mm

  • Infrared - wavelength from 1um to 0.1mm

  • Optical - wavelength from 300nm to 1um

  • UV - wavelength from 100 to 300nm

  • EUV - wavelength from 10 to 100nm

  • Xray - energy from 0.12 to 120keV

  • Gammaray - energy greater than ~120keV

docs.title: abstract objectType Entity
docs.text:
base entity class to support persistence; entity attributes are generally set or updated by persistence implementations

Entityivoa:string idivoa:datetime lastModifiedivoa:anyURI metaChecksumivoa:anyURI metaProducer

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description id  ivoa:string globally unique identifier (primary key) lastModified ivoa:datetime optional timestamp of last modification of this entity; the timestamp is intended to be applied or updated when the entity is stored (e.g. in a database) metaChecksum ivoa:anyURI optional checksum of this entity; (NEW in CAOM-2.3) The URI must conform to the pattern {algorithm}:{value}, for example: md5:4be91751541fd804e7207663a0822f56. The checksum of an entity is computed by accumulating byte representation of individual metadata values in the following order: (1) CaomEntity.id for entities, (2) CaomEntity.metaProducer, (3) state fields in alphabetic order (foo.a comes before foo.b) and using depth-first recursion (foo.abc.x comes before foo.def). Null values are ignored so that the addition of new fields in future versions will not change/invalidate existing checksums until values are assigned. Non-null values are converted to bytes as follows. TODO: add digestFieldNames to algorithm string: UTF-8 encoded bytes URI: UTF-8 encoded bytes of string representation float: IEEE754 single (4 bytes) double: IEEE754 double (8 bytes) boolean: convert to single byte, false=0, true=1 (1 bytes) byte: as-is (1 byte) short: (2 bytes, network byte order == big endian)) integer: (4 bytes, network byte order == big endian) long: (8 bytes, network byte order == big endian) date: truncate time to whole number of seconds and treat as a long (seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC) metaProducer ivoa:anyURI optional identifier for the producer of this entity and child entities with null metaProducer; (NEW in CAOM-2.4) The URI should conform to the pattern {organisation}:{software name-version} (for example: cadc:cfht2caom2-1.1) and identifies the tools used to produce the metadata. This information is intended for use by operators to help diagnose metadata issues.

Planeivoa:anyURI uriivoa:datetime metaReleaseivoa:anyURI metaReadGroupsivoa:datetime dataReleaseivoa:anyURI dataReadGroupscaom2:CalibrationLevel calibrationLevelcaom2:DataProductType dataProductTypeCaomEntityObservableDataQualityMetricsPositionEnergyTimePolarizationCustomAxisVisibilityProvenanceArtifactobservable0..1quality0..1metrics0..1position0..1energy0..1time0..1polarization0..1custom0..1uv0..1provenance0..1artifacts0..*

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description uri ivoa:anyURI optional unique logical identifier for this product; typically made by adding additional path component(s) to the Observation.uri (NEW in CAOM-2.5) metaRelease ivoa:datetime optional timestamp after which metadata for the plane is public; this metaRelease timestamp applies to all children of the plane and to artifacts with releaseType=meta metaReadGroups ivoa:anyURI 0 or more list of groups (of users) that are allowed to view the metadata of the plane; this is applicable when metaRelease is null or in the future (new in CAOM-2.4) dataRelease ivoa:datetime optional timestamp after which data for the plane is public; this dataRelease timestamp applies to all children of the plane and to artifacts with releaseType=data dataReadGroups ivoa:anyURI 0 or more list of groups (of users) that are allowed to access the data of the plane; this is applicable when dataRelease is null or in the future (new in CAOM-2.4) calibrationLevel CalibrationLevel optional standard classification of the degree to which the data is calibrated dataProductType DataProductType optional standard classification of the type of data product; describes the logical data type for the main artifacts observable Observable optional description of the sample (pixel) values; (new in CAOM-2.4) In previous versions the observable was assumed to be flux or intensity of EM radiation. quality DataQuality optional flag indicating the quality of the data metrics Metrics optional collection of measured quantities that describe the content of the data position Position optional description of the position(s) included in the data energy Energy optional descritpion of the energy(ies) included in the data time Time optional description of the time(s) included in the data polarization Polarization optional description of the polarization(s) included in the data custom CustomAxis optional description of a custom coordinate axis in the data (new in CAOM-2.4); Since different custom coordinate types can be used with different planes, instances of CustomAxis can only be compared sensibly if they have the same coordinate type. uv Visibility optional provenance Provenance optional description of the provenance of the data artifacts Artifact 0 or more the component artifacts belonging to this plane

docs.text:
description of polarization measurements included in the data

docs.title: enumeration PolarizationState
docs.text:
a classification of polarization (Stokes states plus other related quantities); work-around: using the name of the literal to convey the serialised value

PolarizationStateIQUVRRLLRLLRXXYYXYYXPOLIFPOLIPOLAEPOLICPOLINPOLI

docs.title: Values
docs.text:
• I - unpolarized

  • Q - Stokes linear Q

  • U - Stokes linear U

  • V - Stokes circular V

  • RR - right-right circular

  • LL - left-left circular

  • RL - right-left cross-circular

  • LR - left-right cross-circular

  • XX - X parallel linear

  • YY - Y parallel linear

  • XY - XY cross-linear

  • YX - YX cross-linear

  • POLI - linear polarized intensity: sqrt(Q^2 + U^2)

  • FPOLI - fractional linear polarization: POLI/I

  • POLA - linear polarization angle: 1/2 arctan(U,Q)

  • EPOLI - elliptical polarization intensity: sqrt(Q^2 + U^2 + V^2)

  • CPOLI - circular polarization intensity: |V|

  • NPOLI - unpolarized intensity: I - EPOLI

docs.title: Values
docs.text:
• PLANNED - (-1) planned data product that does not yet exist

  • RAW_INSTRUMENTAL - (0) raw data in some opaque instrument-specific format

  • RAW_STANDARD - (1) raw data in a common format

  • CALIBRATED - (2) standard calibration steps have been applied

  • PRODUCT - (3) additional non-standard calibration steps have been applied

  • ANALYSIS_PRODUCT - (4) : data product from scientific analysis

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description id ivoa:string globally unique identifier (primary key) lastModified ivoa:datetime optional timestamp of last modification of this entity; the timestamp is intended to be applied or updated when the entity is stored (e.g. in a database) maxLastModified ivoa:datetime optional maximum timestamp of last modification of this entity and all child entities; the timestamp is intended to be applied or updated when the entity is stored (e.g. in a database) metaChecksum ivoa:anyURI optional checksum of this entity; (NEW in CAOM-2.3) The URI must conform to the pattern {algorithm}:{value}, for example: md5:4be91751541fd804e7207663a0822f56. The checksum of an entity is computed by accumulating byte representation of individual metadata values in the following order: (1) CaomEntity.id for entities, (2) CaomEntity.metaProducer, (3) state fields in alphabetic order (foo.a comes before foo.b) and using depth-first recursion (foo.abc.x comes before foo.def). Null values are ignored so that the addition of new fields in future versions will not change/invalidate existing checksums until values are assigned. Non-null values are converted to bytes as follows. string: UTF-8 encoded bytes URI: UTF-8 encoded bytes of string representation float: IEEE754 single (4 bytes) double: IEEE754 double (8 bytes) boolean: convert to single byte, false=0, true=1 (1 bytes) byte: as-is (1 byte) short: (2 bytes, network byte order == big endian)) integer: (4 bytes, network byte order == big endian) long: (8 bytes, network byte order == big endian) date: truncate time to whole number of seconds and treat as a long (seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC) accMetaChecksum ivoa:anyURI optional accumulated checksum of the metadata of this entity and all child entities; (NEW in CAOM-2.3) The URI must conform to the pattern {algorithm}:{value}, for example: md5:4be91751541fd804e7207663a0822f56. The accumulated checksum of an entity is computed by accumulating the byte representation of entity checksums in the following order: (1) the metaChecksum of the current entity, (2) the accMetaChecksum of all child entities accumulated in order of the child's CaomEntity.id. For an entity with no children, the accMetaChecksum is derived only from the metaChecksum but it is not equal to it because it is a checksum of that checksum and not a checksum of the same metadata directly. metaProducer ivoa:anyURI optional identifier for the producer of this entity and child entities with null metaProducer; (NEW in CAOM-2.4) The URI should conform to the pattern {organisation}:{software name-version} (for example: cadc:cfht2caom2-1.1) and identifies the tools used to produce the metadata. This information is intended for use by operators to help diagnose metadata issues.

a quantitatively defined subsection of a data array; the part contains the whole array

classDiagram

        class Chunk{
        caom2:caom2.DataLinkSemantics productType
ivoa:integer naxis

ivoa:integer customAxis
ivoa:integer observableAxis

        }
        Chunk --|> CaomEntity
Chunk *-- "0..1" SpatialWCS : position
Chunk *-- "0..1" SpectralWCS : energy

Chunk *-- "0..1" PolarizationWCS : polarization
Chunk *-- "0..1" CustomWCS : custom
Chunk *-- "0..1" ObservableAxis : observable

link CaomEntity "../caom2.CaomEntity"
link SpatialWCS "../caom2.wcs.SpatialWCS"
link SpectralWCS "../caom2.wcs.SpectralWCS"
link TemporalWCS "../caom2.wcs.TemporalWCS"
link PolarizationWCS "../caom2.wcs.PolarizationWCS"
link CustomWCS "../caom2.wcs.CustomWCS"
link ObservableAxis "../caom2.wcs.ObservableAxis"

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description productType caom2.DataLinkSemantics optional the relationship of this Artifact to the parent Plane (DataLink semantics) naxis ivoa:integer optional number of axes in the data array; value must be in [1,7] since CAOM supports a maximum of seven axes; furthermore, if naxis has a value, the axis index values 1 to {naxis} must be assigned (to positionAxis1, positionAxis2, energyAxis, timeAxis, polarizationAxis, customAxis, and/or observableAxis) and each axis index value assigned to those fields must be unique; axis index values above {naxis} may be assigned in order to preserve the ordering of metadata-only WCS (see FITS-WCS WCSAXES defintion for an example of how this could originate and be used) positionAxis1 ivoa:integer optional index of the first position axis; if set: positionAxis2 and position must also have values positionAxis2 ivoa:integer optional index of the second position axis; if set: positionAxis1 and position must also have values energyAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the energy axis; if set: energy must have a value timeAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the time axis; if set: time must have a value polarizationAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the polarization axis; if set: polarization must have a value customAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the custom axis; if set: custom must have a value observableAxis ivoa:integer optional index of the observable axis; if set: observable must have a value position caom2.wcs.SpatialWCS optional spatial WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if positionAxis1 and positionAxis2 indices are null or have values above {naxis}, then the spatial WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one spatial pixel) energy caom2.wcs.SpectralWCS optional spectral WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if energyAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the spectral WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one spectral pixel) time caom2.wcs.TemporalWCS optional temporal WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if timeAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the time WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one time pixel for the whole data array) polarization caom2.wcs.PolarizationWCS optional polarization WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if polarizationAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the polarization WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one polarization pixel) custom caom2.wcs.CustomWCS optional custom WCS description of the data array or subsection thereof; if customAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the custom WCS is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one custom pixel) observable caom2.wcs.ObservableAxis optional observable description of the data array or subsection thereof; if observableAxis index is null or has a value above {naxis}, then the observable axis is metadata only (usually the degenerate case of one observable for the whole data array)

           <<enumeration>>
Radio
Millimeter
Infrared
Optical
UV
EUV
Xray
Gammaray

docs.title: Values
docs.text:
• Radio - wavelength greater than ~10mm

  • Millimeter - wavelength from 0.1 to 10mm

  • Infrared - wavelength from 1um to 0.1mm

  • Optical - wavelength from 300nm to 1um

  • UV - wavelength from 100 to 300nm

  • EUV - wavelength from 10 to 100nm

  • Xray - energy from 0.12 to 120keV

  • Gammaray - energy greater than ~120keV

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description uri ivoa:anyURI optional unique logical identifier for this product; typically made by adding additional path component(s) to the Observation.uri (NEW in CAOM-2.5) metaRelease ivoa:datetime optional timestamp after which metadata for the plane is public; this metaRelease timestamp applies to all children of the plane and to artifacts with releaseType=meta metaReadGroups ivoa:anyURI 0 or more list of groups (of users) that are allowed to view the metadata of the plane; this is applicable when metaRelease is null or in the future (new in CAOM-2.4) dataRelease ivoa:datetime optional timestamp after which data for the plane is public; this dataRelease timestamp applies to all children of the plane and to artifacts with releaseType=data dataReadGroups ivoa:anyURI 0 or more list of groups (of users) that are allowed to access the data of the plane; this is applicable when dataRelease is null or in the future (new in CAOM-2.4) calibrationLevel caom2.CalibrationLevel optional standard classification of the degree to which the data is calibrated dataProductType caom2.DataProductType optional standard classification of the type of data product; describes the logical data type for the main artifacts observable caom2.Observable optional description of the sample (pixel) values; (new in CAOM-2.4) In previous versions the observable was assumed to be flux or intensity of EM radiation. quality caom2.DataQuality optional flag indicating the quality of the data metrics caom2.Metrics optional collection of measured quantities that describe the content of the data position caom2.Position optional description of the position(s) included in the data energy caom2.Energy optional descritpion of the energy(ies) included in the data time caom2.Time optional description of the time(s) included in the data polarization caom2.Polarization optional description of the polarization(s) included in the data custom caom2.CustomAxis optional description of a custom coordinate axis in the data (new in CAOM-2.4); Since different custom coordinate types can be used with different planes, instances of CustomAxis can only be compared sensibly if they have the same coordinate type. uv caom2.Visibility optional provenance caom2.Provenance optional description of the provenance of the data artifacts caom2.Artifact 0 or more the component artifacts belonging to this plane

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description axis wcs.CoordAxis1D description of the one-dimensional energy axis specsys ivoa:string reference frame for the spectral coordinate ssysobs ivoa:string optional reference frame that is constant over the range of the non-spectral world coordinates ssyssrc ivoa:string optional reference frame for the velocity of the source (zsource) restfrq ivoa:real optional rest frequency of the spectral feature of interest restwav ivoa:real optional rest wavelength of the spectral feature of interest velosys ivoa:real optional correction for the observatory's motion with respect to the barycenter zsource ivoa:real optional redshift of the source (relative to ssyssrc) velang ivoa:real optional angle of true velocity from tangent to line of sight bandpassName ivoa:string optional telescope- or instrument-specific name for the energy band covered by the data; this is usually a filter name transition wcs.EnergyTransition optional description of the energy transition observed resolvingPower ivoa:real optional ratio of wavelength to resolution (lambda/delta-lambda)

docs.title: dataType IntegerQuantity
docs.text:
extends Quantity

An integer number with a unit. Examples of such units that can be used for attributes are bit/byte/kiloByte etc.

«dataType»IntegerQuantityivoa:integer value«dataType»Quantity

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description value integer The integer value of this IntegerQuantity.

docs.title: abstract dataType Quantity
docs.text:
Meant to represent the value of a numerical physical quantity. Can be mapped in VOTables to FIELDrefs and PARAM(ref)s, in which case the @unit attribute of those VOTable elements is assumed to be mapped to the attribute on the Quantity. Ths is only allowed for these predefined ivoa types.

«dataType»Quantityivoa:Unit unit«dataType»IntegerQuantity«dataType»RealQuantity

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description unit Unit optional The unit of this quantity.

docs.title: dataType RealQuantity
docs.text:
extends Quantity

A real value with a unit.

«dataType»RealQuantityivoa:real value«dataType»Quantity

docs.title: Members
docs.text: name type mult description value real The real value of this quantity

docs.title: primitiveType Unit
docs.text:
extends string

Must conform to definition of unit in VOUnit spec.

docs.title: primitiveType anyURI
docs.text:
extends string

Represents a URI in the same way as the datatype of the same nam in XML Schema is used.

docs.title: primitiveType boolean
docs.text: The standard boolean, having values true or false.

docs.title: primitiveType complex
docs.text: Represents a complex number, consisting of a real and imaginary component, both of which are reals. Note that in many contexts there is no native mapping for this type and it must be treated with a custom mapping.

docs.title: primitiveType datetime
docs.text: Represents a moment in time using a date+timestamp.

docs.title: primitiveType integer
docs.text: An integer number (from Z).

docs.title: primitiveType nonnegativeInteger
docs.text: An integer number from N, therefore greater than or equal to 0.

docs.title: primitiveType rational
docs.text: A rational number from Q, represented by two integers, a numerator and a denominator. A native mapping to a serialisation context does in general not exists.

docs.title: primitiveType real
docs.text: A real number (from R).

docs.title: primitiveType string
docs.text: A string, represented as an array of characters treated as a single, primitive value. Ala Java, a string can not be updated, that is any update leads to a different string. However in contrast to Java we assume that two strings that are identical in all their constitutent characters are the same. I.e. string has value type semantics.
